text.p: French "smart card" maker ActivCard said in a statement on Wednesday it had joined Check Point Software Technologies Ltd's OPSEC interoperability alliance.

Check Point is the global network security software market share leader, and OPSEC - Open Platform for Secure Enterprise Connectivity - was designed to "guarantee interoperability at policy level between...leading edge security products", the statement said.
OPSEC enables customers to integrate Check Point applications with those of other vendors.
ActivCard, which is quoted on pan-European growth stocks market Easdaq, makes personal authentication and smart card systems.

"We are delighted to join an alliance whose objectives are consistent with our approach to information security as it is based on open systems technology," ActivCard president and chief executive officer Jean-Gerard Galvez said in the statement.
Check Point has headquarters in Britian and Israel.
